title: U.S. per capita consumption of dried fruit 2000 to 2019
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Per capita consumption in pounds, with a total of 19 data points. The chart has 8 significant trends.
The longest trend is slightly negative which exists from 2018/19 to 2015/16.
Conversely, the next significant trend is moderately negative which exists from 2009/10 to 2006/07.
Contrarily, the next significant trend is extremely negative which exists from 2015/16 to 2013/14.
On the contrary, the next significant trend is extremely negative which exists from 2013/14 to 2011/12.
Differently, the next significant trend is extremely positive which exists from 2011/12 to 2009/10.
Also, the next significant trend is extremely negative which exists from 2006/07 to 2004/05.
But, the next significant trend is moderately negative which exists from 2004/05 to 2002/03.
But, the next significant trend is extremely positive which exists from 2002/03 to 2000/01.
gold: The timeline depicts the per capita consumption of dried fruit in the United States from 2000/2001 to 2018/2019 . According to the report , the U.S. per capita consumption of dried fruit amounted to about 2.34 pounds in 2017/18 . In contrast , Americans consumed 116.75 pounds of fresh fruit per capita in the same year .
